hero.title: Figure Out What to Do Next
hero.subtitle: Tackle tough feedback, conflicts, and decisions in just 5-10 minutes
hero.privacyText: Private, evidence-based, and designed to give you immediate steps forward

challengeTypes.title: What leadership challenge would you like to tackle?

types.title: Give Better Feedback
types.description: Handle challenging or positive feedback conversations effectively

types.title: Resolve Team Conflicts
types.description: Resolve tensions within or between teams

types.title: Align with Stakeholders
types.description: Get buy-in and manage expectations effectively

progress.title: Your Reflection Journey

level.title: Leadership Level
level.description: Your current leadership development stage based on reflection count:

total.title: Total Reflections
total.description: The number of leadership reflections you've completed. Each reflection helps you:

momentum.title: Growth Momentum
momentum.description: Your current reflection momentum and habit development:
levels: Ready to Begin: Starting your journey

motivationalMessages.hasReflections: Great momentum! You're building a powerful habit of structured reflection. Each session sharpens your leadership instincts and gives you proven approaches for future challenges.
motivationalMessages.noReflections: Ready to start? Your first reflection takes just 5-10 minutes and gives you immediate action steps. Each reflection builds your leadership toolkit for future challenges.

progress.patternMessage: Pattern identified: You've been focusing on {category} situations. This indicates active skill development in this leadership area.

descriptions.empty: No reflections yet - start your leadership journey above

firstLevel.title: Need help choosing?
firstLevel.description: Consider the primary challenge you're facing right now. Here are some quick examples to guide you:

examples.title: Feedback
examples.description: Performance conversations, recognition, or developmental discussions

examples.title: Conflict
examples.description: Team disagreements, interpersonal tensions, or disputes

examples.title: Decision
examples.description: Strategic choices, resource allocation, or process decisions

firstLevel.proTip: Pro tip: Choose the category that represents your biggest pain point right now. You can always come back for other challenges later!

secondLevel.title: Conflict is normal - let's work through it together
secondLevel.description:
Conflict isn't a failure of leadership; it's a natural part of working with people who care about different things. The key is approaching it thoughtfully rather than avoiding it or reacting emotionally.

🤔 Structured reflection helps you step back, understand the dynamics, and find a path forward that preserves relationships.

benefits.title: One-on-one conflicts (You & Someone)
benefits.description: When you have tension with a colleague, team member, or stakeholder

benefits.title: Team member conflicts (Person A & Person B)
benefits.description: When two people you work with are in disagreement and you need to help

benefits.title: Multi-team conflicts (Team vs Team)
benefits.description: When different groups have competing priorities or conflicting approaches

structuredInput.title: Structured Input
structuredInput.description: Add each item separately for better organization. You can add as many as needed.

ai.title: AI Assistant
ai.description: AI suggestions would appear here, based on anonymized input to protect your privacy. This feature helps provide additional perspectives while keeping your data secure.

validation.required: This field is required to continue
validation.requiredAnalysis: Please provide analysis for at least one item to continue
validation.requiredListItem: Please add at least one item to continue

copyToast.title: Copied to Clipboard! 📋
copyToast.description: Your reflection progress is ready to paste into your preferred AI assistant for guidance and insights.
copyToast.privacyText: You're sharing personal leadership reflections. Consider using local LLMs (like Ollama) for maximum privacy, or only use trusted AI services and avoid sharing sensitive company information.

referencedAnswers.analyzeLabel: Analyze each item from your previous answer:
referencedAnswers.analysisPlaceholder: How does this relate to the current question? (e.g., alignment, conflicts, constraints, etc.)

actionPlan.proTip: Pro tip: Start with the first 1-2 actions. Leadership change is most effective when implemented gradually and consistently.

header.title: Leadership Frameworks Guide
header.subtitle: Comprehensive explanations of all available frameworks to help you choose the right approach for your leadership challenges.
header.badge: Research-backed • Proven in practice • Ready to use

tableOfContents.title: Table of Contents
tableOfContents.description: Jump to any framework for detailed information

footer.title: Ready to get started?
footer.description: Each framework is designed to be practical and immediately actionable. Choose the one that matches your current challenge, or start with a new reflection to get a personalized recommendation.

layout.tagline: Pause, reflect, and move forward with purpose.

features.title: 100% Local Storage
features.description: All reflections stay on your device

features.title: No Data Collection
features.description: We don't track, store, or analyze your content

about.title: About This Service
about.description: Reflect & Act is a privacy-focused leadership reflection tool designed to help engineering leaders navigate situational challenges through structured frameworks. All data is stored locally on your device and no personal information is collected or transmitted.
